episodes.title: Exposing IBLP Gothard's Commandment Cosplay and Blame Shifting Logic | Episode 14
episodes.description:
In this episode, we combine three parts of the Exposing IBLP series to explore Bill Gothard’s tangled web of “convictions,” parenting formulas, and blame-shifting theology. Gothard teaches that when families struggle, it’s because someone’s disobeying — a dangerous idea that traps followers in endless cycles of guilt and “spiritual fixes.”

We’ll unpack how the phrase “doing it in your own strength” was used to judge anyone who dared to struggle, how a “slothful” son is somehow destined to beat his father to retirement (???), and why daughters were told to adopt their father’s “God-given goals.”

From there, we dive into Gothard’s infamous Conviction Quiz and his so-called Ten Basic Convictions — which turn out to be little more than Commandment cosplay. Behind the Scripture references lies a system built on control, contradictions, and shifting definitions of what “faithfulness” really means.

Join me as we look at how Gothard turned spiritual growth into a checklist, convictions into control, and parenting advice into a blame game that kept everyone under his authority — right where he wanted them.

Umbrella Rebellion is a podcast where we share our experience in the ATI/IBLP and fundamental cults. We are on a journey of healing and exposing the teachings that lead to and justify abuse. It is our hope that those who are experiencing abuse can find support and escape from it.

episodes.description:
In this episode, we dive into the “Ten Basic Convictions” section of the IBLP Men’s Manual, where Bill Gothard lays out a list of supposedly essential beliefs—each backed by carefully selected Old and New Testament verses. But as we take a closer look, something becomes clear: these convictions are just thinly veiled versions of the Ten Commandments. While Gothard claims they’re scripturally grounded, the distinction between a “conviction” and a “preference” remains murky at best. Join me as I unpack this confusing doctrine, verse by verse, and explore what’s really going on beneath the surface of Gothard’s spiritual checklists.

episodes.title: Exposing IBLP | Can You Pass Gothard’s Conviction Quiz | Spoiler I Failed | Part 42
episodes.description:
In this episode, we take a deep dive into Bill Gothard’s confusing—and often contradictory—definition of “convictions.” According to Gothard, convictions are unchanging, visible, and must be a core part of your daily life. But does that mean they can never evolve? And if a conviction doesn't look like something Gothard says it should, is it really just a “preference”?  

We’ll explore Gothard’s flawed logic with examples like his take on addiction, leadership in the home, and even how he defines what’s “harmful” for kids. Along the way, I’ll share why this rigid framework causes more harm than good and why questioning these “convictions” can be the key to finding real freedom.  Plus, I’ll be reading off the 10 key convictions from Part 25 of the series to see how they stack up against Gothard’s warped standards.  Can you pass Gothard’s Conviction Quiz? episodes.title: Taylor Swift’s Tradwife Era? A Cult Survivor Explains
episodes.description:
In this episode, I share my perspective as a former cult member on Taylor Swift’s latest album and her public image shift. For years, Taylor has been framed as the “good girl” of pop culture—an image that left little room for her to be seen as a fully grown, sexual woman. Now, as she embraces engagement and hints at family life, the rebrand feels less like personal freedom and more like a step into the tradwife pipeline.

I talk about the parallels between how cults restrict women’s sexuality and how Taylor has been infantilized in the media. I even predict that in 10–15 years, we may hear a very different story about her relationship with Travis.

Whether you’re a die-hard Swiftie or just curious about the cultural shifts around her, this is a conversation about image, power, and how women in the public eye are still boxed in by old expectations.

episodes.title: Exposing IBLP: Gothard Twists Childhood Development into Rebellion - Demands Obedience Through Fear
episodes.description:
In this episode, we delve into Bill Gothard’s troubling teachings from the IBLP Men’s Manual, where normal childhood behaviors are labeled as rebellion, and natural curiosity is framed as spiritual defiance. We start with Gothard’s “Early Signs of Rebellion” checklist, which misinterprets typical developmental stages as threats to parental authority. From there, we explore how Gothard uses graphic imagery, such as the raven and eagle analogy, to instill fear and manipulate obedience. His use of disturbing visuals—like a raven pecking at the eye of a cow—turns ordinary child development into a source of anxiety and control. Join me as we examine how these teachings contribute to a culture of fear, shame, and confusion in families.

episodes.description:
Bill Gothard’s teachings in the IBLP Men’s Manual are filled with unrealistic expectations and puzzling tactics. In this episode, we examine his flawed and idealistic view of wives’ emotional responses, despite never being married himself, and how his perspective creates damaging expectations within marriages. We also take a closer look at his unusual habit of making readers jump ahead to specific pages rather than following the material in order. Why does he direct fathers to a later section about building godly character and making their wives “radiant with God’s Word”? Is this just a quirk in his writing, or does it serve a deeper purpose in controlling the narrative? Join me as we break down these problematic teachings and their real-world implications.

episodes.description:
Bill Gothard’s teachings in IBLP shaped how followers viewed history, health, and family control—often in contradictory and harmful ways. He claimed history doesn’t repeat itself because prophecy gives it meaning, discouraging critical thinking and allowing him to rewrite the past to fit his agenda. 

At the same time, his obsession with ‘godliness’ led to extreme teachings on health and self-care, where physical well-being was minimized—unless it could be used as another tool for control, especially over women. These distorted beliefs worked together to enforce multi-generational submission, keeping families locked into his system. In this episode, we break down how Gothard manipulated these ideas to maintain power and control.

episodes.title: The Gothard Doctrine: Bill Gothard's Controlling Views News and History | IBLPs Men's Manual Part 4
episodes.description:
In this episode of Exposing IBLPs Men's Manual, we dive into Bill Gothard’s controversial views on news reporting and history writing. Gothard argues that a newspaper should not report all the facts because "the public has a right to know," citing the idea that "the truth shall make you free." But his take on truth is far from balanced. His dangerous views on omitting or filtering the reports through "God's word" can lead to the omission of reporting on dangerous individuals the public has a right to be aware of. 

Gothard claims that truth out of balance leads to error and that detrimental information about people shouldn’t be made public until it’s thoroughly vetted. He believes that public news media should never violate God’s moral standards—but at what cost? This mindset is what has lead to a white-washing of history and control over what gets reported.

We also explore Gothard's take on objectivity in news reporting and history writing, where he rejects the idea that anyone can be truly objective. He argues that all reporters are inevitably influenced by their own biases and philosophies and that facts should always emphasize God’s truths rather than neutral, unbiased information.

In this episode, I break down how Gothard’s controlling mindset shapes both news and history, stifling objective reporting and shaping public perception in dangerous ways. How does this impact the way we view the past and present? 

Tune in to learn more about the implications of his teachings on media, truth, and history.

Comment below and let us know your thoughts.

episodes.title: Discussion with Certified Sex Therapist Marc Prevette || Sexuality and Purity Culture Part II
episodes.description: Marcy and Dee will be talking with Psychotherapist and Certified Sex Therapist, Marc Prevette about sexuality and healing from purity culture. We look forward to diving into this topic with a professional mental health expert. Marc Prevette ( sounds like - Pre-Vet) is a board-certified licensed psychotherapist, certified sex therapist, and clinical supervisor. He has received extensive training in multiple trauma therapy approaches and supervises and teaches future counselors and sex therapists. In addition to his direct clinical experience, he has had the privilege of speaking at several university functions on topics of sexuality, gender, sex education, and trauma. He spoke on the issues of sexuality and aging, improving sexuality education for medical professionals, and the ethical impacts of poor bias control toward sexuality subjects by clinical professionals in other formats.
